bwwExcerpt: "Still, punk nihilism and showbiz spirit-fingers are uneasy  bedfellows.  And at times, Idiot’s efforts to meld the two are  jarring. In  that sense, Billie Joe Armstrong and director/co-writer  Michael Mayer’s  decision to emphasize songs over story may have  actually done them a  favor; it keeps the action moving swiftly and  leaves little time to  linger on narrative weakness. Purists on either  side of the  punk/Broadway divide will likely feel under-s
